value.0:
*looks up from feeding the chickens*

Ehh? What are you doing here, <boy/girl>? I am retired, no more readings!
Of course! What do you want to know?
Well, haven't seen then around in some time... Heard they worshiped some lord of the undead or such. Good riddance if you ask me.
Indeed. The dead are restless, though. I sometimes hear them screaming and wailing even down here, and their spirits haunt my dreams. I have seen things you people wouldn't believe... *shivers*
Yes. That's why I stopped reading people's hands... those damn spirits are attracted to it and flock around me like bees...
Yes. That's why I stopped reading people's hands... those damn spirits are attracted to it and flock around me like bees... could you do me a favour?
You look like an able <lad/lass>, not one of those frightened peasants who drop dead when they see a ghost... can you go to Aigheshed and see if you can put one or more of those spirits to rest?

Dunno. Haven't seen him for some time... must have run for the hills, as most 'noble' people do when the odds are against 'em. 

He summoned some fiend to do his bidding, you know... but the creature was a bit too powerful for him, and things spiralled out of control. Within hours a floodwave of screaming monsters emerged from the cellars and crypts around Aigheshed and razed the place to the ground. 

A few people managed to escape, but they were completely mad from the ordeal... that's all I know.
You are. In the forest you got to the east and you'll find it. Lovely little town... a few years ago. Now a smoking ruin filled with demons and undead.

It's all the fault of that bloody stupid Jarl of ours. Thought he could bargain with the Dark Gods... well, look what happened. 

Then those dam fool cultists tried to do make the same bargains, now even most of the normal creatures are gone. *sighs and shakes her head*
I am a retired seer. Done. Finito. No more readings.
I am Laisa. Seer. Retired. Guess you can call me a Blind now. *cackles*

Nah.. they can't climb down here, besides most of the big things are gone now. Just the demons and walking dead these days and anything that wants to make a jump for my chickens, well, with this height they end up as rugs. *points at the bear skin*

Tis a good place here, <boy/girl>, and I am glad I don't need to chop my chickens to bits just because some fop wants me to read their entrails.
You bet! Clara over there lays like a rabbit, haha. An egg a day keeps the cleric away! Take one if you like, I have plenty.
I dreamt about you... you have slain one of the spirits that torment me. Thank you.
There you are again... did you visit Aigheshed?
I see... a cellar... a cellar... yes.
OK, I'll bugger off then.
Can I ask a few questions? It's not about any reading or whatever!
What this about these cultists?
So, all the folks from Aigheshed are insane, lost, or dead?
That must be quite an ordeal for you as well?
Can I ask another question first?
Perhaps, but can I ask another question first?
Who knows?
Sounds waaaaay to dangerous! I am off!
Your stories are very interesting, so I am going there anyway. I'll see what I can do for you.
This Jarl... what about him?
I am looking for Aigheshed. Am I on the right track?
What's wrong with the forest above? It feels creepy!
I see. Can I ask another question?
Readings?
Don't worry, I am not going to ask you to to read my palm. Can I ask a few questions?
Who are you?
Don't worry, I am not going to ask you to to read my palm. You're living here alone? There's nasty critters out there, you know.
I understand. They are nice chickens. Lotsa eggs, I bet?
Thank you. I must be going now.
O, thanks. Can I ask another question first?
Most welcome.
Yes, but I couldn't find any wailing spirits...
Alright.. will look for a cellar.
Not yet.
